assessment: STRONG - Excellent on expertise and authority, very strong on experience and trust

experience.definition: Does the content demonstrate first-hand knowledge, practical insights, and real-world understanding?

examples: Opening: 'If you want to buy a horse...' (du form, personal address)
Practical tips section uses 'du' consistently
Realistic expectations: 'Most buyers need a leisure horse' (80% estimate)

examples: Marketplace navigation with specific platform differences (ehorses international, Willhaben local)

evidence.strength: HIGH - Practical advice that could only come from experience

examples: 'Anfänger unterschätzen immer die monatlichen Kosten'

evidence.indicator: Step-by-step guidance following actual buyer journey

examples: 'Pferde sind wie Autos – sie deprecieren'

experience.assessment: Article consistently demonstrates practical, real-world knowledge throughout. The author clearly understands the buyer's journey, pain points, and realistic expectations. Personal perspective is maintained without being anecdotal.

expertise.definition: Does the author demonstrate deep, specialized knowledge of the subject matter?

examples: ehorses: '17.000+ Inserate, international Marktplatz' (exact figures)

indicators.strength: HIGH - Not generic descriptions, platform-specific details

indicators.strength: HIGH - Shows understanding of legal framework
